poem:
**The Central Bank's Dalliance**

In whispers of stagnant numbers  
the pound breathes uncut,  
  
frozen hearts—  
the Bank of England waits,  
  
cool in the lingering fog while  
across the waters,  
America's eager scissors snip—  
economies unfold.  

Here, patience is traded  
for the stillness of coins.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why did the Bank of England not cut interest rates? After the Federal Reserve’s monster 0.5 percentage point cut in US borrowing costs on Wednesday, it seemed strange that the Bank of England should sit on its hands and keep interest rates on hold. From a position earlier this year when the UK’s central bank was leading the way in cutting interest rates, it is now a laggard. The European Central Bank is also ahead,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
